etymologies: late 19th century: from modern Latin Eurypterus (genus name), from eury- + Greek pteron ‘wing’+ -id

definitions: an extinct marine arthropod of a group occurring in the Paleozoic era. They are related to horseshoe crabs and resemble large scorpions with a terminal pair of paddle-shaped swimming appendages.

notes.text: Subclass Eurypterida, class Merostomata, subphylum Chelicerata

shortDefinitions: giant fossil marine arthropod of group occurring in Palaeozoic era
